back: they no longer drag the plow (now)
they carry (it) out of the field
it’s not possible to lift it
for it is possible to lift
it’s not possible to carry it
the farmers wait for their friends
the slaves carry the stones out

front: {{c1::λίθος}} δὲ μέγας ἐν τῷ ἀγρῷ ἐστίν
back: but a big stone is in the field
it is not possible to carry out
drive the oxen to the field!
it is possible to lift the stone

front: φέρει δὲ τὸ δεῖπνον πρὸς τὸν {{c1::πατέρα}}
back: he brings dinner to his father
dig up the stones and carry (them) out

front: τὸ δὲ ἄροτρον λείπουσιν ἐν τῷ {{c1::ἀγρῷ}}
back: but they leave the plow in the field
